newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Cheung Kong/Hutch to fund Tung Chung internally.
newsitem.headline: Cheung Kong/Hutch to fund Tung Chung internally.

text.p: Cheung Kong (Holdings) Ltd and Hutchison Whampoa Ltd will fund development of the Tung Chung Station Package Three project from internal resources, Cheung Kong deputy chairman Victor Li said.
"There is not any financing arrangement for this project," Li told reporters on Wednesday. "Cheung Kong and Hutchison seldom seek financing for an individual project."
"And with the present scale of Cheung Kong and Hutchison, even though this Tung Chung project is big, we don't need special financing arrangements for this project," he said.
Li said Cheung Kong and Hutchison had no immediate plan to raise fund or seek financing in the near future, but declined to disclose the latest figures for their internal resources.
A consortium equally owned by Cheung Kong and associate Hutchison on Wednesday signed a contract for the Tung Chung Package Three development with the Mass Transit Railway Corp.

The 6.79-hectare development will produce about 4,310 high-rise and low-rise residential flats, 5,000 square metres of shop space and 987 car parking spaces, giving a total gross floor area of 306,700 square metres.
